respStmt.resp: Transcribed from images of original letters
respStmt.name: Sarah Tew
Giuliano Sidro
Millie You
Maddie Qualls

publicationStmt.distributor: The Center for the Tebtunis Papyri, The University of California, Berkeley
publicationStmt.authority: The Board of Trinity College Dublin, The University of Dublin

availability.p: Available for academic research purposes only.

objectDesc.p: Handwritten letter on one rectangular sheet folded in half. All four pages that are created have handwritten texts on them.
Catalog number '97' written in pencil. Previous number that starts with "1" erased and overwritten with "97".
Printed letterhead in red ink at top right reads:

recordHist.p: Images taken from Trinity College, Dublin: Page 1Pages 2-3Page 4

projectDesc.p: This document was created as part of the History of Papyrology project [https://histpap.info/] by Sarah Tew, Giuliano Sidro, Maddie Qualls, and Millie You. The project is in affiliation the Center for Tebtunis Papyri at the University of California, Berkeley.

editorialDecl.p: Text has been transcribed diplomatically without corrections, normalization, or standardization.

punctuation.p: All punction marks have been retained nd represented using the appropriate Unicode code character except for apostrophes and ampersands which have been escaped using ' and &, respectively.

segmentation.p: The text has been segmented into lines according to line breaks in the original text automatically by Transkribus and line groupings based on groups identified automatically or manually declared by Sarah Tew in Transkribus. Page breaks have been manually edited by Sarah Tew, Giuliano Sidro, Maddie Qualls, and Millie You after export from Transkribus.

handNotes.handNote: Written in black ink by B.P. Grenfell.

revisionDesc.change: Manually added TEI header to Transkribus tei.xml exported file.

body.ab:
My dear Smyly,
I enclose Jouguet's
article, which you can keep
for the winter. Presumably the ^new number
hasnt reached England yet.
The new number of the Urkunden
(III. 11) is devoted to Ptolemaic
pieces, cheifly contracts from Gebelen

but there are some very broken 3rd
cent B.C. documents which look
as if they came from Fayum mummy
cartonnage. A double date occurs, but
the Macedonian month is lost.
Jouguet's papyri by the way make me
more than ever sure that Diophantus
in P.P.II p. 3 was strategus
In Euergetes' reign, not Philadelphus'.
I also enclose corrected proof of
those classical fragments in O.P. III
which are in type. The rest of the book

is written and will be printed
during our absence, and the proofs
will be sent to you in relays. I
dont want them back till April.
We hope to return before the middle
of that month. We leave on the
7th and shall make a short
trip to Wadi Halfa before beginning
excavations at Hibeh early in
January. Address Cairo, as usual.
Various letters have come from foreign
scholars who profess admiration for
Tebtunis. Wilcken talks of it as an
'Ereigniss für unsere Wissenschaft' and

says he will come to Oxford next
August or September to see the papyri
I hope you will be here too. De Ricci,
who is now στρατευόμενος for a year,
is publishing revised texts of Revillout's
Ptolemaic papyri in the next Archiv.
Bury will be a great loss to you. I am
rather surprised he should care to go. But
I suppose Mrs B. was keen on England.

Love to J.P.M.
Good-bye
Yours ever
B.P.Grenfell
